com.vmware.vcenter.host.entropy

Interface ExternalPool

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ExternalPoolTypes, com.vmware.vapi.bindings.Service
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ExternalPoolStub

    public interface ExternalPool
extends com.vmware.vapi.bindings.Service, ExternalPoolTypes
    The ExternalPool interface provides methods to send entropy data and query external entropy pool information on an ESX host. Clients can check the entropy level of an ESX host using the get(java.lang.String) method to check com.vmware.vcenter.host.entropy.ExternalPool#Info. When the entropy level has dropped below a threshold, a client can use the add(java.lang.String, com.vmware.vcenter.host.entropy.ExternalPoolTypes.AddSpec) method to add additional entropy until as required. This interface was added in vSphere API 8.0.1.0.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.vmware.vcenter.host.entropy.ExternalPoolTypes

    • Method Detail

      • get

        ExternalPoolTypes.Info get(java.lang.String host)
        Retrieves the entropy pool details of a host including current entropy level. This method was added in vSphere API 8.0.1.0.

        Synchronous method overload. Result of the invocation will be reported as a method return value.

        Parameters:
        host - Identifier of the host. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: HostSystem.
        Returns:
        Entropy details of a host.
        Throws:
        Error - if there is a generic error.
        NotFound - if the host is not found.
        ServiceUnavailable - if the host is not available.
        Unauthenticated - if the caller is not authenticated.
        Unauthorized - if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows:
        • The resource HostSystem referenced by the parameter host requires Host.Entropy.Read.

      • add

        ExternalPoolTypes.AddResult add(java.lang.String host,
                                ExternalPoolTypes.AddSpec spec)
        Adds additional entropy to the pool. This API will accept maximum (ExternalPoolTypes.Info.getCapacity() - ExternalPoolTypes.Info.getCurrentlyAvailable()) bytes of entropy. Extra entropy data sent will be discarded. This method was added in vSphere API 8.0.1.0.

        Synchronous method overload. Result of the invocation will be reported as a method return value.

        Parameters:
        host - Identifier of the host. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: HostSystem.
        spec - contains buffer of entropy data.
        Returns:
        Result of add() method.
        Throws:
        Error - if there is a generic error.
        NotFound - if the host is not found.
        ServiceUnavailable - if the host is not available.
        Unauthenticated - if the caller is not authenticated.
        Unauthorized - if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows:
        • The resource HostSystem referenced by the parameter host requires Host.Entropy.Write.
